definition[0]: the first part of a website’s address, which usually begins with ‘www.’ and ends with ‘.com’, ‘.org’, ‘.uk’, or other letters that show which country the website is from
definition[1]: the address of a computer NETWORK connected to the Internet. A domain name is followed by an abbreviation which could show its type, for example.com for a company, or its country of origin, for example.uk for the United Kingdom
